snippet: Mr. Trump and Mrs. Clinton accused each other of mistreating women and signaled that the final month of the presidential race would be an ugly political brawl....
abstract: Donald J Trump and Hillary Clinton attack each other in nearly nonstop hostility during second debate, hurling character assaults, tawdry allegations and angry accusations at each other; both candidates are noticeably uneasy during 90-minute town hall event that is seen by many as profoundly ugly moment in American politics.

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and JONATHAN MARTIN

lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump and Mrs. Clinton accused each other of mistreating women and signaled that the final month of the presidential race would be an ugly political brawl.

headline.main: In Second Debate, Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton Spar in Bitter, Personal Terms
headline.print_headline: Personal Attacks in the Forefront at Caustic Debate
